name: Walter Röhrl
bio: A master tactician and tarmac specialist, Röhrl won two World Rally Championships during the early 1980s and tamed the fearsome Group B monsters.

name: Hannu Mikkola
bio: One of the fastest and most consistent drivers of the early 1980s, Mikkola secured the 1983 World Rally Championship for Audi’s Quattro program.

name: Ari Vatanen
bio: The 1981 World Champion, Vatanen was known for his fearless driving style and legendary comebacks after brutal accidents.

name: Stig Blomqvist
bio: A master of snowy conditions and Group B all-wheel-drive cars, Blomqvist clinched the 1984 World Rally Championship for Audi.

name: Timo Salonen
bio: The relaxed Finnish powerhouse, Salonen won the 1985 World Rally Championship driving the brutal Peugeot 205 T16.

name: Juha Kankkunen
bio: Fast, smooth, and calculated, Kankkunen began dominating the late 1980s, winning his first World Championship in 1986 with Peugeot.

name: Miki Biasion
bio: The Italian rally ace became Lancia's top gun in the late 1980s, claiming back-to-back World Rally Championships in 1988 and 1989.

name: Henri Toivonen
bio: Brilliant and fearless, Toivonen was destined for greatness before his tragic death at the 1986 Tour de Corse ended an era.
